parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
(a) of persons: powerful, able, (b) of things: possible. From dunamai; powerful or capable; neuter possible.
(a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From paraballo; a similitude, i.e. fictitious narrative, apothegm or adage.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a primary komeo; properly, to provide for, i.e. to carry off.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From hos with the directive enclitic of source; from which place or source or cause.
